alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:31AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Very Stormy Weekend For Western Alaska... A very strong storm developing in the Western Bering Sea today will bring strong southerly winds, snow and blowing snow with blizzard conditions to St lawrence Island and the Bering Strait by early Saturday, and to the remainder of the West Coast on Saturday that will continue into Sunday and taper off on Sunday night or Monday. Snow and winds will spread into the Western Interior on Saturday night. Expect 4-8 inches of snow across most of the West Coast and Western Interior with this Sat through Sun, with over 12 inches possible along south facing slopes. Freezing rain is possible Saturday into Sunday from the Yukon Delta across the Southern Interior. Blizzard conditions will occur over most of the West Coast Saturday and Saturday night. Winds could gusts to 75 mph Saturday and Saturday night along Western Capes, and to 50 to 60 mph along most of the West Coast, with gusts to 40 mph in the Western Interior Saturday night and Sunday. These strong winds will cause sea level rises of 3-4 ft Saturday into Sunday along the West Coast south of Point Hope. This will cause water to seep up on top of the ice near the coast Saturday and Sunday from Point Hope south, similar to what occurred earlier this week. Some coastal trails on the ice or near the shore could become inundated with water. Please stay tuned for additional updates.
